newsitem.title: USA: Goldman reshapes units, to phase out J.Aron name.
newsitem.headline: Goldman reshapes units, to phase out J.Aron name.

text.p: Goldman Sachs said Friday that it will merge three of its divisions into one which will be run by a three-man management team.
As part of the restructuring, the J. Aron trading name will be phased out, Goldman said.
"We have essentially consolidated, merged the fixed income divsion, the currency and commodities division into a single operating unit," said a Goldman spokesman.
"It is a ratification of what's been happening over the past few years as there has been more synergy between the units," he added.
Richard Garonzik and Michael Mortara are currently co-heads of the fixed income division, while Lloyd Blankfein is head of the J. Aron currency and commodities trading unit.
Under the new structure, the three become joint heads of the merged division and Blankfein moves to London, while the other two remain New York-based.

The J. Aron name will remain for certain entities for legal reasons but will be phased out over time, the Goldman spokesman said. Goldman acquired J. Aron, then primarily a commodities trading house, in the early 1980s.

The spokesman said that though there may be a few more changes within the management group of the divisions, "it will not be resulting in layoffs or mass movements of personnel. J. Aron currency and commodities has been performing at a record pace this year."
